00034 char * FSAL_GetFSName()
00035 {
00036 #ifdef _USE_HPSS_51
00037         return "HPSS 5.1";
00038 #elif defined( _USE_HPSS_62) || defined ( _USE_HPSS_622 )
00039         return "HPSS 6.2";
00040 #else
00041         return "HPSS";
00042 #endif
00043 }

00046 
00063 int FSAL_handlecmp( fsal_handle_t * handle1, fsal_handle_t * handle2,
00064                     fsal_status_t * status ){
00065    
00066   
00067   fsal_u64_t  fileid1, fileid2;
00068   
00069   *status =  FSAL_STATUS_NO_ERROR;
00070    
00071   if (!handle1 || !handle2 ){
00072     status->major = ERR_FSAL_FAULT ;
00073     return -1;   
00074   }  
00075   
00076   /* hpss_HandleCompare returns wrong results for hardlinks :
00077    * it says that the two objects are different.
00078    * so we use our own comparation method,
00079    * by comparing fileids.
00080    */
00081   fileid1 = hpss_GetObjId( &handle1->ns_handle );
00082   fileid2 = hpss_GetObjId( &handle2->ns_handle );  
00083     
00084   if ( fileid1 > fileid2 )
00085     return 1;
00086   else if ( fileid2 == fileid1 )
00087     return 0;
00088   else
00089     return -1;  
00090        
00091 }

00108 unsigned int FSAL_Handle_to_HashIndex( fsal_handle_t * p_handle,
00109                                     unsigned int cookie,
00110                                     unsigned int alphabet_len,
00111                                     unsigned int index_size)
00112 {
00113 #define SMALL_PRIME_MULT        3
00114 #define SMALL_PRIME_ADD         1999 
00115 #define HASH_INCR( _h_, _i_ )        ( _h_ = (_h_ * SMALL_PRIME_MULT + SMALL_PRIME_ADD) % _i_ )
00116 
00117         unsigned int h = cookie;
00118         unsigned int i;
00119         unsigned32   objid = hpss_GetObjId( &p_handle->ns_handle );
00120 
00121         h ^= p_handle->ns_handle.Generation ;
00122         HASH_INCR( h, index_size );
00123         h ^= objid ;
00124         HASH_INCR( h, index_size );
00125         h ^= p_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID.time_low ;
00126         HASH_INCR( h, index_size );
00127         h ^= p_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID.time_mid ;
00128         HASH_INCR( h, index_size );
00129         h ^= p_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID.time_hi_and_version ;
00130         HASH_INCR( h, index_size );
00131         h ^= p_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID.clock_seq_hi_and_reserved ;
00132         HASH_INCR( h, index_size );
00133         h ^= p_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID.clock_seq_low ;
00134         HASH_INCR( h, index_size );
00135         
00136         for ( i = 0; i < 6; i++ )
00137         {
00138                 h ^= p_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID.node[i] ;
00139                 HASH_INCR( h, index_size );
00140         } 
00141         
00142         return h % index_size; 
00143         
00144 }
00145 
00146 
00147 /*
00148  * FSAL_Handle_to_RBTIndex
00149  * This function is used for generating a RBT node ID
00150  * in order to identify entries into the RBT.
00151  *
00152  * \param p_handle      The handle to be hashed
00153  * \param cookie        Makes it possible to have different hash value for the
00154  *                      same handle, when cookie changes.
00155  *
00156  * \return The hash value
00157  */
00158 
00159 unsigned int FSAL_Handle_to_RBTIndex( fsal_handle_t * p_handle, unsigned int cookie )
00160 {
00161         unsigned int h;
00162         unsigned int i;
00163         unsigned32   objid = hpss_GetObjId( &p_handle->ns_handle );
00164 
00165         h = cookie ;
00166         h ^= p_handle->ns_handle.Generation << 1;
00167         h ^= objid << 2 ;
00168 
00169         h ^= p_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID.time_low << 3;
00170         h ^= p_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID.time_mid  << 4;
00171         h ^= p_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID.time_hi_and_version << 5;
00172         h ^= p_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID.clock_seq_hi_and_reserved << 6;
00173         h ^= p_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID.clock_seq_low << 7;
00174 
00175         for ( i = 0; i < 6; i++ )
00176         {
00177                 h ^= ((unsigned int)p_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID.node[i]) << 8+i;
00178         }
00179 
00180         return h;
00181 }

00184 
00202 fsal_status_t FSAL_DigestHandle(
00203     fsal_export_context_t  * p_expcontext,    /* IN */
00204     fsal_digesttype_t        output_type,     /* IN */
00205     fsal_handle_t          * in_fsal_handle,  /* IN */
00206     caddr_t                  out_buff         /* OUT */
00207 ){
00208   
00209   /* min size for nfs handle digest. */
00210   int memlen = sizeof( ns_ObjHandle_t ) - sizeof( TYPE_UUIDT );
00211   
00212   unsigned32  objid;   /* to store objID */
00213   
00214   fsal_u64_t  objid64;   /* to cast the objID */  
00215   
00216   fsal_nodetype_t nodetype; /* to store object  type */
00217       
00218   /* sanity checks */
00219   if (!in_fsal_handle || !out_buff || !p_expcontext) ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 );
00220   
00221   switch(output_type){   
00222     
00223     /* NFSV2 handle digest */    
00224     case  FSAL_DIGEST_NFSV2:
00225       
00226       /* The hpss handle must be converted
00227        * to a 25 bytes handle. To do so,
00228        * We copy all the fields from the hpss handle,
00229        *  except the Coreserver ID.
00230        */
00231       
00232 #ifndef _NO_CHECKS
00233       
00234       /* sanity check about output size */
00235       
00236       if ( memlen > FSAL_DIGEST_SIZE_HDLV2 )
00237         ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_TOOSMALL, 0 );
00238         
00239 #endif
00240 
00241       /* sanity check about core server ID */
00242       
00243       if ( memcmp( &in_fsal_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID,
00244                    &p_expcontext->fileset_root_handle.CoreServerUUID,
00245                    sizeof(TYPE_UUIDT)) ){
00246         char buffer[128];
00247         snprintmem(buffer,128,(caddr_t)&(in_fsal_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID),sizeof(TYPE_UUIDT));
00248         DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,
00249                       "Invalid CoreServerUUID in HPSS handle: %s",buffer);
00250       }
00251 
00252       /* building digest :
00253        * - fill it with zeros
00254        * - setting the first bytes to the fsal_handle value
00255        *   (except CoreServerUUID)
00256        */
00257       memset( out_buff,0,FSAL_DIGEST_SIZE_HDLV2 );
00258       memcpy( out_buff,&(in_fsal_handle->ns_handle),memlen );
00259       
00260       break;
00261 
00262       
00263     /* NFSV3 handle digest */      
00264     case  FSAL_DIGEST_NFSV3:
00265       
00266       /* The hpss handle must be converted
00267        * to a 25 bytes handle. To do so,
00268        * We copy all the fields from the hpss handle,
00269        *  except the Coreserver ID.
00270        */
00271       
00272 #ifndef _NO_CHECKS
00273       
00274       /* sanity check about output size */
00275       
00276       if ( memlen > FSAL_DIGEST_SIZE_HDLV3 )
00277         ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_TOOSMALL, 0 );
00278         
00279 #endif
00280 
00281       /* sanity check about core server ID */
00282 
00283       if ( memcmp( &in_fsal_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID,
00284                    &p_expcontext->fileset_root_handle.CoreServerUUID,
00285                    sizeof(TYPE_UUIDT)) ){
00286         char buffer[128];
00287         snprintmem(buffer,128,(caddr_t)&(in_fsal_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID),sizeof(TYPE_UUIDT));
00288         DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,
00289                       "Invalid CoreServerUUID in HPSS handle: %s",buffer);
00290       }
00291 
00292       /* building digest :
00293        * - fill it with zeros
00294        * - setting the first bytes to the fsal_handle value
00295        *   (except CoreServerUUID)
00296        */
00297       memset( out_buff,0,FSAL_DIGEST_SIZE_HDLV3 );
00298       memcpy( out_buff,&(in_fsal_handle->ns_handle),memlen );
00299       
00300       break;
00301 
00302           
00303     /* NFSV4 handle digest */
00304     case  FSAL_DIGEST_NFSV4:
00305       
00306       /* The hpss handle must be converted
00307        * to a 25 bytes handle. To do so,
00308        * We copy all the fields from the hpss handle,
00309        *  except the Coreserver ID.
00310        */
00311       
00312 #ifndef _NO_CHECKS
00313       
00314       /* sanity check about output size */
00315       
00316       if ( memlen > FSAL_DIGEST_SIZE_HDLV4 )
00317         ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_TOOSMALL, 0 );
00318         
00319 #endif
00320 
00321       /* sanity check about core server ID */
00322       
00323       if ( memcmp( &in_fsal_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID,
00324                    &p_expcontext->fileset_root_handle.CoreServerUUID,
00325                    sizeof(TYPE_UUIDT)) ){
00326         char buffer[128];
00327         snprintmem(buffer,128,(caddr_t)&(in_fsal_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID),sizeof(TYPE_UUIDT));
00328         DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,
00329                       "Invalid CoreServerUUID in HPSS handle: %s",buffer);
00330       }
00331       
00332       /* building digest :
00333        * - fill it with zeros
00334        * - setting the first bytes to the fsal_handle value
00335        *   (except CoreServerUUID)
00336        */
00337       memset( out_buff,0,FSAL_DIGEST_SIZE_HDLV4 );
00338       memcpy( out_buff,&(in_fsal_handle->ns_handle),memlen );
00339       
00340       break;
00341       
00342       
00343     /* FileId digest for NFSv2 */
00344     case  FSAL_DIGEST_FILEID2:      
00345       
00346       /* get object ID from handle */
00347       objid = hpss_GetObjId( &in_fsal_handle->ns_handle );
00348 
00349 #ifndef _NO_CHECKS
00350       
00351       /* sanity check about output size */
00352       
00353       if ( sizeof(unsigned32) > FSAL_DIGEST_SIZE_FILEID2 )
00354         ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_TOOSMALL, 0 );
00355         
00356 #endif
00357             
00358       memset( out_buff,0,FSAL_DIGEST_SIZE_FILEID2 );
00359       memcpy( out_buff,&objid,sizeof(unsigned32) );
00360 
00361       
00362       break;
00363       
00364       
00365     /* FileId digest for NFSv3 */
00366     case  FSAL_DIGEST_FILEID3:
00367       
00368       /* get object ID from handle */
00369       objid64 = hpss_GetObjId( &in_fsal_handle->ns_handle );      
00370       
00371 #ifndef _NO_CHECKS
00372       
00373       /* sanity check about output size */
00374       
00375       if ( sizeof(fsal_u64_t) > FSAL_DIGEST_SIZE_FILEID3 )
00376         ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_TOOSMALL, 0 );
00377         
00378 #endif
00379             
00380       memset( out_buff,0,FSAL_DIGEST_SIZE_FILEID3 );
00381       memcpy( out_buff,&objid64,sizeof(fsal_u64_t) );
00382       break;
00383       
00384       
00385     /* FileId digest for NFSv4 */
00386       
00387     case  FSAL_DIGEST_FILEID4:
00388       /* get object ID from handle */
00389       objid64 = hpss_GetObjId( &in_fsal_handle->ns_handle );
00390 
00391 #ifndef _NO_CHECKS
00392       
00393       /* sanity check about output size */
00394       
00395       if ( sizeof(fsal_u64_t) > FSAL_DIGEST_SIZE_FILEID4 )
00396         ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_TOOSMALL, 0 );
00397         
00398 #endif
00399             
00400       memset( out_buff,0,FSAL_DIGEST_SIZE_FILEID4 );
00401       memcpy( out_buff,&objid64,sizeof(fsal_u64_t) );
00402       break;      
00403     
00404     /* Nodetype digest. */
00405     case FSAL_DIGEST_NODETYPE:  
00406       
00407       nodetype = in_fsal_handle->obj_type;
00408       
00409 #ifndef _NO_CHECKS
00410       
00411       /* sanity check about output size */
00412       
00413       if ( sizeof(fsal_nodetype_t) > FSAL_DIGEST_SIZE_NODETYPE )
00414         ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_TOOSMALL, 0 );
00415         
00416 #endif
00417             
00418       memset( out_buff,0,FSAL_DIGEST_SIZE_NODETYPE );
00419       memcpy( out_buff,&nodetype,sizeof(fsal_nodetype_t) );
00420       
00421       break;
00422     
00423       
00424     default:
00425       ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_SERVERFAULT ,0 );
00426   }
00427   
00428   ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR,0);
00429   
00430 }

00433 
00449 fsal_status_t FSAL_ExpandHandle(
00450     fsal_export_context_t   * p_expcontext,    /* IN */
00451     fsal_digesttype_t         in_type,         /* IN */
00452     caddr_t                   in_buff,         /* IN */
00453     fsal_handle_t           * out_fsal_handle  /* OUT */
00454 ){
00455   
00456   /* significant size in nfs digests */
00457   int memlen = sizeof( ns_ObjHandle_t ) - sizeof( TYPE_UUIDT ); 
00458   
00459   /* sanity checks */
00460   if (!out_fsal_handle || !in_buff || !p_expcontext) ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 );
00461   
00462   switch(in_type){
00463     
00464     case  FSAL_DIGEST_NFSV2:
00465       
00466       memset(out_fsal_handle,0,sizeof(fsal_handle_t));
00467       memcpy(&out_fsal_handle->ns_handle,in_buff,memlen);
00468       
00469       memcpy(&out_fsal_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID,
00470              &p_expcontext->fileset_root_handle.CoreServerUUID,sizeof(TYPE_UUIDT));
00471       
00472       out_fsal_handle->obj_type = hpss2fsal_type( out_fsal_handle->ns_handle.Type );
00473       
00474       break;
00475       
00476     case  FSAL_DIGEST_NFSV3:
00477       
00478       memset(out_fsal_handle,0,sizeof(fsal_handle_t));
00479       memcpy(&out_fsal_handle->ns_handle,in_buff,memlen);
00480 
00481       memcpy(&out_fsal_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID,
00482              &p_expcontext->fileset_root_handle.CoreServerUUID, sizeof(TYPE_UUIDT));
00483       
00484       out_fsal_handle->obj_type = hpss2fsal_type( out_fsal_handle->ns_handle.Type );
00485       
00486       break;
00487       
00488     case  FSAL_DIGEST_NFSV4:
00489       
00490       memset(out_fsal_handle,0,sizeof(fsal_handle_t));
00491       memcpy(&out_fsal_handle->ns_handle,in_buff,memlen);
00492       memcpy(&out_fsal_handle->ns_handle.CoreServerUUID,
00493              &p_expcontext->fileset_root_handle.CoreServerUUID,sizeof(TYPE_UUIDT));
00494       
00495       out_fsal_handle->obj_type = hpss2fsal_type( out_fsal_handle->ns_handle.Type );
00496       
00497       break;
00498       
00499     default:
00500       /* Invalid input digest type. */
00501       ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL ,0 );
00502   }
00503   
00504   ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR,0);  
00505   
00506 }

00509 
00517 fsal_status_t  FSAL_SetDefault_FSAL_parameter(
00518                              fsal_parameter_t *  out_parameter )
00519 {
00520 
00521   log_t   no_logging = LOG_INITIALIZER;
00522   
00523   /* defensive programming... */  
00524   if ( out_parameter == NULL )
00525       ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_FAULT, 0 );
00526   
00527   /* init logging to no logging */  
00528   out_parameter->fsal_info.log_outputs = no_logging;
00529   
00530   /* init max FS calls = unlimited */
00531   out_parameter->fsal_info.max_fs_calls = 0;
00532 
00533   ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 );    
00534   
00535 }
00536

00538 fsal_status_t  FSAL_SetDefault_FS_common_parameter(
00539                              fsal_parameter_t *  out_parameter )
00540 {
00541   /* defensive programming... */  
00542   if ( out_parameter == NULL )
00543       ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_FAULT, 0 );
00544   
00545   /* set default values for all parameters of fs_common_info */
00546   
00547   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, maxfilesize );
00548   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, maxlink );
00549   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, maxnamelen );
00550   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, maxpathlen );
00551   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, no_trunc );
00552   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, chown_restricted );
00553   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, case_insensitive );
00554   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, case_preserving );
00555   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, fh_expire_type );
00556   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, link_support );
00557   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, symlink_support );  
00558   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, named_attr );
00559   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, unique_handles );
00560   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, lease_time );
00561   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, acl_support );
00562   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, cansettime );
00563   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, homogenous );
00564   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, supported_attrs );
00565   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, maxread );
00566   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, maxwrite );
00567   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, umask );
00568   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, auth_exportpath_xdev );  
00569   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_common_info, xattr_access_rights );  
00570   
00571   ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 );  
00572     
00573 }

00578 fsal_status_t  FSAL_SetDefault_FS_specific_parameter(
00579                              fsal_parameter_t *  out_parameter )
00580 {
00581   /* defensive programming... */  
00582   if ( out_parameter == NULL )
00583       ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_FAULT, 0 );
00584   
00585   /* set default values for all parameters of fs_specific_info */
00586   
00587 #ifdef _USE_HPSS_51  
00588   
00589   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_specific_info, PrincipalName);
00590   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_specific_info, KeytabPath);
00591   
00592 #elif defined( _USE_HPSS_62 ) || defined ( _USE_HPSS_622 )
00593   
00594   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_specific_info, AuthnMech);
00595   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_specific_info, NumRetries);
00596   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_specific_info, BusyDelay);
00597   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_specific_info, BusyRetries);
00598   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_specific_info, MaxConnections);
00599   
00600   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_specific_info, DebugPath);
00601   
00602   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_specific_info, Principal);
00603   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_specific_info, KeytabPath);
00604   
00605 #endif
00606   
00607   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_specific_info, CredentialLifetime);
00608   FSAL_SET_INIT_DEFAULT( out_parameter->fs_specific_info, ReturnInconsistentDirent);
00609 
00610   ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 );  
00611   
00612 }

00617 
00640 /* load FSAL init info */
00641  
00642 fsal_status_t  FSAL_load_FSAL_parameter_from_conf(
00643       config_file_t       in_config,
00644       fsal_parameter_t *  out_parameter
00645     )
00646 {
00647   int     err;
00648   int     var_max, var_index;
00649   char *  key_name;
00650   char *  key_value;  
00651   config_item_t   block;
00652   
00653   int  DebugLevel   = -1;
00654   char * LogFile    = NULL;
00655 
00656   
00657   block = config_FindItemByName( in_config, CONF_LABEL_FSAL );
00658 
00659   /* cannot read item */  
00660   
00661   if ( block == NULL )
00662   {
00663     DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: Cannot read item \"%s\" from configuration file",
00664         CONF_LABEL_FSAL );
00665     ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_NOENT, 0 );
00666   }
00667   else if ( config_ItemType(block) != CONFIG_ITEM_BLOCK )
00668   {
00669     DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: Item \"%s\" is expected to be a block",
00670         CONF_LABEL_FSAL );
00671      ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
00672   }
00673       
00674   /* read variable for fsal init */
00675   
00676   var_max = config_GetNbItems( block );
00677   
00678   for ( var_index = 0; var_index < var_max ; var_index ++ )
00679   {    
00680     config_item_t item;
00681     
00682     item = config_GetItemByIndex( block, var_index );
00683     
00684     err = config_GetKeyValue( 
00685                         item,
00686                         &key_name,
00687                         &key_value
00688                        );
00689     if ( err ){
00690       DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR reading key[%d] from section \"%s\" of configuration file.",
00691             var_index, CONF_LABEL_FSAL );
00692       ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_SERVERFAULT, err );
00693     }
00694         
00695     if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "DebugLevel" ) )
00696     {
00697       DebugLevel = ReturnLevelAscii( key_value );
00698       
00699       if ( DebugLevel == -1 ){
00700         DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Invalid debug level name: \"%s\".",
00701               key_value );
00702         ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, -1 );        
00703       }
00704       
00705     }
00706     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "LogFile" ) )
00707     {
00708       
00709       LogFile = key_value ;
00710       
00711     }
00712     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "Max_FS_calls" ) )
00713     {
00714       
00715         int maxcalls = s_read_int( key_value );
00716 
00717         if ( maxcalls < 0 )
00718         {
00719           DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: null or positive integer expected.",key_name);
00720           ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
00721         }
00722            
00723         out_parameter->fsal_info.max_fs_calls = (unsigned int) maxcalls;
00724       
00725     }
00726     else
00727     {
00728       DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unknown or unsettable key: %s (item %s)",
00729           key_name, CONF_LABEL_FSAL ) ;
00730       ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
00731     }
00732 
00733   }
00734   
00735   /* init logging */
00736   
00737   if ( LogFile )
00738   {
00739     desc_log_stream_t  log_stream;
00740     
00741     strcpy( log_stream.path , LogFile );
00742     
00743     /* Default : NIV_CRIT */
00744     
00745     if ( DebugLevel == -1 )
00746       AddLogStreamJd( &(out_parameter->fsal_info.log_outputs),
00747           V_FILE, log_stream, NIV_CRIT, SUP);
00748     else         
00749       AddLogStreamJd( &(out_parameter->fsal_info.log_outputs),
00750           V_FILE, log_stream, DebugLevel, SUP);
00751         
00752   }
00753 
00754   ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 );        
00755   
00756 } /* FSAL_load_FSAL_parameter_from_conf */
00757 
00758 
00759 
00760 /* load general filesystem configuration options */
00761 
00762 fsal_status_t  FSAL_load_FS_common_parameter_from_conf(
00763       config_file_t       in_config,
00764       fsal_parameter_t *  out_parameter
00765     )
00766 {
00767   int     err;
00768   int     var_max, var_index;
00769   char *  key_name;
00770   char *  key_value;  
00771   config_item_t   block;
00772   
00773   block = config_FindItemByName( in_config, CONF_LABEL_FS_COMMON );
00774   
00775   /* cannot read item */  
00776   if ( block == NULL )
00777   {
00778     DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: Cannot read item \"%s\" from configuration file",
00779         CONF_LABEL_FS_COMMON );
00780     ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_NOENT, 0 );
00781   }
00782   else if ( config_ItemType(block) != CONFIG_ITEM_BLOCK )
00783   {
00784     DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: Item \"%s\" is expected to be a block",
00785         CONF_LABEL_FS_COMMON );
00786      ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
00787   }
00788   
00789   /*
00790   configurable common info for filesystem are:
00791   link_support      # hardlink support
00792   symlink_support   # symlinks support
00793   cansettime        # Is it possible to change file times
00794   maxread           # Max read size from FS
00795   maxwrite          # Max write size to FS
00796   umask
00797   auth_exportpath_xdev
00798   xattr_access_rights
00799   */
00800   
00801   var_max = config_GetNbItems( block );
00802   
00803   for ( var_index = 0; var_index < var_max ; var_index ++ )
00804   {    
00805     config_item_t item;
00806     
00807     item = config_GetItemByIndex( block, var_index );
00808     
00809     err = config_GetKeyValue( 
00810                         item,
00811                         &key_name,
00812                         &key_value
00813                        );
00814     if ( err ){
00815       DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR reading key[%d] from section \"%s\" of configuration file.",
00816             var_index, CONF_LABEL_FS_COMMON );
00817       ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_SERVERFAULT, err );
00818     }
00819     
00820     /* does the variable exists ? */
00821     if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "link_support" ) )
00822       {
00823         
00824         int bool = StrToBoolean( key_value );
00825         
00826         if ( bool == -1 )
00827         {
00828           DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: boolean expected.",key_name);
00829           ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
00830         }
00831         
00832         /* if set to false, force value to false.
00833          * else keep fs default.
00834          */
00835         FSAL_SET_INIT_INFO( out_parameter->fs_common_info, link_support,
00836             FSAL_INIT_MAX_LIMIT, bool );
00837             
00838       }
00839     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "symlink_support" ) )
00840       {
00841         int bool = StrToBoolean( key_value );
00842         
00843         if ( bool == -1 )
00844         {
00845           DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: boolean expected.",key_name);
00846           ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
00847         }
00848         
00849         /* if set to false, force value to false.
00850          * else keep fs default.
00851          */
00852         FSAL_SET_INIT_INFO( out_parameter->fs_common_info, symlink_support,
00853             FSAL_INIT_MAX_LIMIT, bool );
00854       }
00855     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "cansettime" ) )
00856       {
00857         int bool = StrToBoolean( key_value );
00858         
00859         if ( bool == -1 )
00860         {
00861           DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: boolean expected.",key_name);
00862           ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
00863         }
00864         
00865         /* if set to false, force value to false.
00866          * else keep fs default.
00867          */
00868         FSAL_SET_INIT_INFO( out_parameter->fs_common_info, cansettime,
00869             FSAL_INIT_MAX_LIMIT, bool );
00870         
00871       }
00872     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "maxread" ) )
00873       {
00874         fsal_u64_t  size;
00875         
00876         if ( s_read_int64( key_value , &size ) )
00877         {
00878           DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: positive integer expected.",key_name);
00879           ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
00880         }
00881         
00882         FSAL_SET_INIT_INFO( out_parameter->fs_common_info, maxread,
00883             FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE, size );
00884         
00885          
00886       }
00887     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "maxwrite" ) )
00888       {
00889         fsal_u64_t  size;
00890         
00891         if ( s_read_int64( key_value , &size ) )
00892         {
00893           DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: positive integer expected.",key_name);
00894           ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
00895         }
00896         
00897         FSAL_SET_INIT_INFO( out_parameter->fs_common_info, maxwrite,
00898             FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE, size );
00899                 
00900       }
00901     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "umask" ) )
00902       {
00903         int mode = s_read_octal( key_value );
00904         
00905         if ( mode < 0 )
00906         {
00907           DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: octal expected.",key_name);
00908           ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
00909         }
00910         
00911         FSAL_SET_INIT_INFO( out_parameter->fs_common_info, umask,
00912             FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE, unix2fsal_mode(mode) );
00913         
00914       }
00915     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "auth_xdev_export" ) )
00916       {
00917         int bool = StrToBoolean( key_value );
00918         
00919         if ( bool == -1 )
00920         {
00921           DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: boolean expected.",key_name);
00922           ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
00923         }
00924         
00925         FSAL_SET_INIT_INFO( out_parameter->fs_common_info, auth_exportpath_xdev,
00926             FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE, bool );
00927       }
00928     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "xattr_access_rights" ) )
00929       {
00930         int mode = s_read_octal( key_value );
00931         
00932         if ( mode < 0 )
00933         {
00934           DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: octal expected.",key_name);
00935           ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
00936         }
00937         
00938         FSAL_SET_INIT_INFO( out_parameter->fs_common_info, xattr_access_rights,
00939             FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE, unix2fsal_mode(mode) );
00940         
00941       }
00942     else
00943     {
00944       DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unknown or unsettable key: %s (item %s)",
00945           key_name, CONF_LABEL_FS_COMMON ) ;
00946       ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
00947     }
00948         
00949   }
00950     
00951   ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 );    
00952     
00953 } /* FSAL_load_FS_common_parameter_from_conf */
00954 
00955 
00956 
00957 
00958 /* load specific filesystem configuration options */
00959 
00960 fsal_status_t  FSAL_load_FS_specific_parameter_from_conf(
00961       config_file_t       in_config,
00962       fsal_parameter_t *  out_parameter
00963     )
00964 {
00965   int     err;
00966   int     var_max, var_index;
00967   char *  key_name;
00968   char *  key_value;   
00969   config_item_t   block;
00970   
00971   block = config_FindItemByName( in_config, CONF_LABEL_FS_SPECIFIC );
00972   
00973   /* cannot read item */  
00974   if ( block == NULL )
00975   {
00976     DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: Cannot read item \"%s\" from configuration file",
00977         CONF_LABEL_FS_SPECIFIC );
00978     ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_NOENT, 0 );
00979   }
00980   else if ( config_ItemType(block) != CONFIG_ITEM_BLOCK )
00981   {
00982     DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: Item \"%s\" is expected to be a block",
00983         CONF_LABEL_FS_SPECIFIC );
00984      ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
00985   }
00986   
00987   var_max = config_GetNbItems( block );
00988   
00989   for ( var_index = 0; var_index < var_max ; var_index ++ )
00990   {
00991     config_item_t item;
00992     
00993     item = config_GetItemByIndex( block, var_index );
00994     
00995     err = config_GetKeyValue( 
00996                         item,
00997                         &key_name,
00998                         &key_value
00999                        );
01000     if ( err ){
01001       DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR reading key[%d] from section \"%s\" of configuration file.",
01002             var_index, CONF_LABEL_FS_SPECIFIC );
01003       ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_SERVERFAULT, err );
01004     }
01005     
01006 #ifdef _USE_HPSS_51  
01007     /* does the variable exists ? */
01008     if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "PrincipalName" ) )
01009       {
01010         
01011         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.behaviors.PrincipalName
01012             = FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE;
01013         strcpy( out_parameter->fs_specific_info.hpss_config.PrincipalName,
01014             key_value );
01015             
01016       }
01017     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "KeytabPath" ) )
01018       {
01019         
01020         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.behaviors.KeytabPath
01021             = FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE;
01022         strcpy( out_parameter->fs_specific_info.hpss_config.KeytabPath,
01023             key_value );
01024             
01025       }    
01026 #elif defined( _USE_HPSS_62 ) || defined ( _USE_HPSS_622 )
01027     /* does the variable exists ? */
01028     if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "PrincipalName" ) )
01029       {        
01030         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.behaviors.Principal
01031             = FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE;
01032         strcpy( out_parameter->fs_specific_info.Principal,
01033             key_value );
01034             
01035       }
01036     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "KeytabPath" ) )
01037       {
01038         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.behaviors.KeytabPath
01039             = FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE;
01040         strcpy( out_parameter->fs_specific_info.KeytabPath,
01041             key_value );            
01042       }
01043     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "AuthMech" ) )
01044       {
01045         int error;
01046         
01047         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.behaviors.AuthnMech
01048             = FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE;
01049         
01050         error = hpss_AuthnMechTypeFromString( key_value,
01051                   &out_parameter->fs_specific_info.hpss_config.AuthnMech );
01052         
01053         if (error != HPSS_E_NOERROR)
01054         {
01055           DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s.",key_name);
01056           ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, error );
01057         }
01058         
01059       }
01060     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "BusyDelay" ) )
01061       {
01062         int busydelay = s_read_int( key_value );
01063 
01064         if ( busydelay < 0 )
01065         {
01066           DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: positive integer expected.",key_name);
01067           ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
01068         }
01069            
01070         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.behaviors.BusyDelay
01071             = FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE;
01072         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.hpss_config.BusyDelay = busydelay;
01073       }
01074     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "BusyRetries" ) )
01075       {
01076         int busyretries;
01077         
01078         if ( key_value[0] == '-' )
01079         {
01080           busyretries = s_read_int( (char *)(key_value+1) );
01081           if (busyretries < 0)
01082           {
01083             DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: integer expected.",key_name);
01084             ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
01085           }
01086           busyretries = -busyretries;            
01087         }
01088         else
01089         {
01090           busyretries = s_read_int( key_value );
01091 
01092           if ( busyretries < 0 )
01093           {
01094             DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: integer expected.",key_name);
01095             ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
01096           }
01097         }
01098            
01099         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.behaviors.BusyRetries
01100             = FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE;
01101         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.hpss_config.BusyRetries = busyretries;
01102       }
01103     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "NumRetries" ) )
01104       {
01105         int numretries;
01106         
01107         if ( key_value[0] == '-' )
01108         {
01109           numretries = s_read_int( (char *)(key_value+1) );
01110           if (numretries < 0)
01111           {
01112             DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: integer expected.",key_name);
01113             ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
01114           }
01115           numretries = -numretries;            
01116         }
01117         else
01118         {
01119           numretries = s_read_int( key_value );
01120 
01121           if ( numretries < 0 )
01122           {
01123             DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: integer expected.",key_name);
01124             ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
01125           }
01126         }
01127            
01128         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.behaviors.NumRetries
01129             = FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE;
01130         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.hpss_config.NumRetries = numretries;
01131       }
01132     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "MaxConnections" ) )
01133       {
01134         int maxconn = s_read_int( key_value );
01135 
01136         if ( maxconn < 0 )
01137         {
01138           DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: positive integer expected.",key_name);
01139           ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
01140         }
01141            
01142         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.behaviors.MaxConnections
01143             = FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE;
01144         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.hpss_config.MaxConnections = maxconn;
01145       } 
01146     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "DebugPath" ) )
01147       {
01148         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.behaviors.DebugPath
01149             = FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE;
01150         strcpy( out_parameter->fs_specific_info.hpss_config.DebugPath,
01151             key_value );
01152       }
01153      
01154 #endif      
01155     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "CredentialLifetime" ) )
01156       {
01157         int cred_life = s_read_int( key_value );
01158 
01159         if ( cred_life < 1 )
01160         {
01161           DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: positive integer expected.",key_name);
01162           ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
01163         }
01164            
01165         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.behaviors.CredentialLifetime
01166             = FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE;
01167         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.CredentialLifetime = (fsal_uint_t)cred_life;
01168       }
01169     else if ( !STRCMP( key_name, "ReturnInconsistentDirent" ) )
01170       {
01171         int bool = StrToBoolean( key_value );
01172         
01173         if ( bool == -1 )
01174         {
01175           DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unexpected value for %s: boolean expected.",key_name);
01176           ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
01177         }
01178 
01179         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.behaviors.ReturnInconsistentDirent
01180             = FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE;
01181         out_parameter->fs_specific_info.ReturnInconsistentDirent = (fsal_uint_t)bool;
01182       }
01183     else
01184       {
01185         DisplayLog("FSAL LOAD PARAMETER: ERROR: Unknown or unsettable key: %s (item %s)",
01186             key_name, CONF_LABEL_FS_SPECIFIC ) ;
01187         ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0 );
01188       }
01189         
01190   }  
01191     
01192    ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 );  
01193     
01194 } /* FSAL_load_FS_specific_parameter_from_conf */
